title: IELTS Listening Test 15
content: Complete IELTS Listening Test 15 with all 4 sections (40 questions)

questions.instructions: Questions 1-5. Complete the form below with the applicant's personal details using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS OR A NUMBER.
questions.question:
Applicant information form:
Name: Anne [field 1]
D.O.B.: 22nd of [field 2], 1981
Address: [field 3] Simon Place, Brighton
Contact number: (01903) [field 4]
Mobile: [field 5]

1.correct: ✓ Correct! HAWBERRY is the applicant's surname. The admissions officer confirms the spelling: 'H-A-W-B-E-R-R-Y'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is HAWBERRY. Listen for when Anne states 'It's Anne Hawberry' and the officer confirms the spelling.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is HAWBERRY. Listen carefully when the applicant introduces herself at the beginning of the conversation.

2.correct: ✓ Correct! MAY is the month of birth. Anne states her date of birth is '22 May 1981'.
2.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is MAY. Listen for when Anne gives her complete date of birth.
2.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is MAY. The applicant provides her full date of birth during the personal details section.

3.correct: ✓ Correct! The address is 26 Simon Place. Anne clearly states this when providing her contact details.
3.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is 26. Listen carefully when Anne provides her full address.
3.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is 26. Pay attention to the address details given by the applicant.

4.correct: ✓ Correct! 714721 is the phone number (after 01903). Anne repeats this number when asked to confirm.
4.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is 714721 (or 534 345 based on one mention, but she corrects to 714 721). Note: If your answer was marked wrong but you have 714721, please let us know!
4.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is 714721. Listen when Anne provides and then repeats her contact number.

5.correct: ✓ Correct! Anne does not have a mobile phone. She explicitly states 'No, I don't' when asked.
5.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is NO MOBILE PHONE (or similar). Anne clearly states she doesn't have one.
5.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is NO MOBILE PHONE. Listen when the admissions officer asks about mobile phone details.

questions.instructions:
Questions 6 to 10
Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 6. What is the applicant's current job?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Anne works as a SECRETARY. She states 'I am working for Lloyd Enterprises in the city as a secretary'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is SECRETARY. Listen when Anne describes her current employment.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is SECRETARY. Anne mentions her current job when discussing her work experience.

questions.instructions:
Questions 6 to 10
Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 7. What university course has she already completed?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Anne completed a BUSINESS DEGREE. She mentions 'I completed a degree in Business degree a year ago'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is BUSINESS (DEGREE). Listen when Anne discusses her educational background.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is BUSINESS (DEGREE). Pay attention when Anne talks about her qualifications.

questions.instructions:
Questions 6 to 10
Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 8. Why does the MBA course get full quickly?

field_answers.1: it's extremely popular|extremely popular|it is extremely popular

1.correct: ✓ Correct! The MBA is EXTREMELY POPULAR. The admissions officer warns: 'our MBA programme is extremely popular and gets full quickly'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is IT'S EXTREMELY POPULAR. Listen to the admissions officer's warning about the MBA programme.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is IT'S EXTREMELY POPULAR. The officer explains why she should consider alternatives.

questions.instructions:
Questions 6 to 10
Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 9. What is her second choice?

field_answers.1: international marketing|international marketing course|ma in international marketing

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Her second choice is INTERNATIONAL MARKETING. Anne says 'I would also be interested in the MA in International Marketing'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is INTERNATIONAL MARKETING (COURSE). Listen when Anne discusses alternative courses.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is INTERNATIONAL MARKETING. Anne mentions this as her backup option.

questions.instructions:
Questions 6 to 10
Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 10. Which department will contact the applicant?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! The ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT will contact her. The officer states 'I will pass your details on to our admissions department'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT. Listen at the end when the officer explains the next steps.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT. Pay attention to the officer's closing remarks about the application process.

questions.instructions: Questions 11-15. Answer the questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 11. Specific lifestyle changes for whom is the speaker talking about?

field_answers.1: women|changes for women|changes for women|for women

1.correct: ✓ Correct! The speaker discusses lifestyle CHANGES FOR WOMEN (or just WOMEN). The transcript references changes in women's roles and lifestyles.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is WOMEN or CHANGES FOR WOMEN. Listen for references to who has experienced lifestyle changes.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is WOMEN or CHANGES FOR WOMEN. The speaker discusses demographic-specific lifestyle shifts.

questions.instructions: Questions 11-15. Answer the questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 12. Name ONE example of a good which has now become thought of as a necessity.

1.correct: ✓ Correct! DISHWASHER(S) or MICROWAVE(S) are examples mentioned. These appliances have become viewed as necessities rather than luxuries.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is DISHWASHER(S) or MICROWAVE(S). Listen for examples of goods that were once luxuries.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is DISHWASHER(S) or MICROWAVE(S). The speaker gives examples of modern 'necessities'.

questions.instructions: Questions 11-15. Answer the questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 13. In addition to work, what have these goods given us more time for?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! LEISURE PURSUITS (or LEISURE). Modern appliances have freed up time for leisure activities.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is LEISURE PURSUITS or LEISURE. Listen for what people can do with the time saved by modern conveniences.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is LEISURE PURSUITS. The speaker discusses the benefits of time-saving devices.

questions.instructions: Questions 11-15. Answer the questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 14. What do richer societies become?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Richer societies become MORE DEMANDING. The speaker discusses how wealth affects consumer behavior.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is MORE DEMANDING. Listen for how the speaker characterizes wealthier societies.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is MORE DEMANDING. Pay attention to the discussion about societal wealth and expectations.

questions.instructions: Questions 11-15. Answer the questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 15. What does the 'race of acquisition' encourage us to buy?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! The race of acquisition encourages buying UNNECESSARY GOODS. The speaker criticizes consumer culture.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is UNNECESSARY GOODS. Listen for the speaker's critique of modern consumerism.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is UNNECESSARY GOODS. The speaker discusses negative aspects of consumer culture.

questions.instructions:
Questions 16 to 20
Select the correct answer A-C.
questions.question: 16. Who is mostly responsible for creating the demand for new products?

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. While wealth plays a role, this isn't the specific group identified.
✓ Correct! Professionals are identified as a key driver of demand for new products.
Incorrect. Models may influence trends but aren't identified as the primary demand creators.

questions.instructions:
Questions 16 to 20
Select the correct answer A-C.
questions.question: 17. Why should we be concerned with the increasing number of unnecessary appliances?

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. While cost is a factor, the main concern is different.
✓ Correct! Environmental concerns are the primary reason for worry about unnecessary appliances.
Incorrect. Technology pace isn't the main environmental concern.

questions.instructions:
Questions 16 to 20
Select the correct answer A-C.
questions.question: 18. What other risk does the speaker refer to?

mc_options.feedback: ✓ Correct! The speaker mentions the risk of losing traditional skills as a concern.
Incorrect. While health may be mentioned, the focus is on traditional skills.
Incorrect. Career impacts aren't the risk being emphasized.

questions.instructions:
Questions 16 to 20
Select the correct answer A-C.
questions.question: 19. Active buying behaviour will

mc_options.text: cause an increase in manufactured goods
mc_options.feedback: ✓ Correct! Active buying leads to increased demand for manufactured goods.
Incorrect. This isn't the primary consequence discussed.

mc_options.text: is a purely positive aspect of consumer behaviour
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The speaker presents a more nuanced view with concerns.

questions.instructions:
Questions 16 to 20
Select the correct answer A-C.
questions.question: 20. What does the speaker recommend for the future?

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This isn't the recommendation.
Incorrect. While sustainability is important, this isn't the specific recommendation.
✓ Correct! The speaker recommends purchasing in moderation as a solution.

questions.instructions: Question 21. Choose the correct letter A–C.
questions.question: 21. Helen became a vegetarian

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. While a timeframe may be mentioned, this isn't why she became vegetarian.
Incorrect. Family influence isn't given as the reason.
✓ Correct! Helen became vegetarian for personal reasons.

questions.instructions: Questions 22-24. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: 22. According to Helen, what is the most important food source for vegetarians?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! SOYA (or SOYA BEAN) is identified as the most important food source for vegetarians.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is SOYA. Listen when Helen discusses essential vegetarian protein sources.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is SOYA. Helen emphasizes this as a key vegetarian food source.

questions.instructions: Questions 22-24. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: 23. According to Helen, what do most countries do to vegetables?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Most countries OVERCOOK vegetables. Helen mentions this as a common problem.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is OVERCOOK THEM. Listen for Helen's criticism of cooking methods.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is OVERCOOK THEM. Helen discusses common vegetable preparation mistakes.

questions.instructions: Questions 22-24. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: 24. According to Helen, it is a misconception people have that vegetarians are what?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! The misconception is that vegetarians are UNHEALTHY. Helen addresses this false belief.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is UNHEALTHY. Listen when Helen discusses common misconceptions about vegetarianism.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is UNHEALTHY. Helen challenges stereotypes about vegetarian diets.

questions.instructions:
Questions 25 to 30
Complete the table using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER.
questions.question:
Food GroupRecommended % of diet
Fruit and Vegetables[field 1] %
Carbohydrates[field 2] %
[field 3]12%
[field 4]15%
[field 5]8%
[field 6]8%

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Fruit and vegetables should comprise 21% of the diet according to the table.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is 21. Listen for the percentage recommendations for each food group.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is 21. Pay attention to the nutritional breakdown discussed.

2.correct: ✓ Correct! Carbohydrates should be 44% of the diet - the largest portion.
2.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is 44. Listen for the carbohydrate percentage in the recommended diet.
2.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is 44. This is the largest food group percentage mentioned.

3.correct: ✓ Correct! CEREALS comprise 12% of the recommended diet.
3.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is CEREALS. Listen for which food group accounts for 12%.
3.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is CEREALS. This food group is at 12% of the diet.

4.correct: ✓ Correct! DAIRY products make up 15% of the recommended diet.
4.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is DAIRY. Listen for the 15% food category.
4.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is DAIRY. This accounts for 15% in the nutritional breakdown.

5.correct: ✓ Correct! WHITE MEAT should be 8% of the diet.
5.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is WHITE MEAT. Listen for the protein sources and their percentages.
5.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is WHITE MEAT. One of the 8% categories in the table.

6.correct: ✓ Correct! RED MEAT should also be 8% of the diet.
6.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is RED MEAT. This is the other 8% protein category.
6.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is RED MEAT. The final 8% category mentioned.

questions.instructions: Questions 31 and 32. Complete the following sentence using ONE WORD.
questions.question: 31. East feels [field 1] therapy is a better word than 'alternative'.

1.correct: ✓ Correct! East prefers the term NATURAL. He explicitly states 'I prefer the term "natural"'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is NATURAL. Listen at the beginning when East discusses terminology.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is NATURAL. East clarifies his preferred terminology early in the discussion.

questions.instructions: Questions 31 and 32. Complete the following sentence using ONE WORD.
questions.question: 32. Osteopathy involves the manipulation of [field 1] in order to remove stresses and strains.

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Osteopathy manipulates MUSCLES. East defines it as 'the manipulation of muscles in order to alleviate stresses and tensions'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is MUSCLES. Listen to East's definition of osteopathy.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is MUSCLES. East provides a clear definition of what osteopathy involves.

questions.instructions: Questions 33-36. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 33. According to Matthew East, what must be considered when treating a patient?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! THE WHOLE BODY must be considered. East emphasizes 'The whole body must be considered before a course of treatment can be decided upon'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is THE WHOLE BODY. Listen when East explains the holistic approach of osteopathy.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is THE WHOLE BODY. East stresses this as a key principle of natural remedies.

questions.instructions: Questions 33-36. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 34. According to Matthew East, what was the original cause of the baby's discomfort?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! A DIFFICULT BIRTH caused the problem. East explains 'the real problem stemmed from a difficult birth which had put pressure on their baby's neck'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is A DIFFICULT BIRTH. Listen to East's case study about treating a baby.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is A DIFFICULT BIRTH. East uses this as an example of finding root causes.

questions.instructions: Questions 33-36. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 35. How does East describe the use of drugs and operations?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! East describes them as INVASIVE. He states 'Avoiding such invasive methods of treatment highlights another of the differences'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is INVASIVE. Listen when East contrasts natural remedies with conventional medicine.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is INVASIVE. East uses this term to describe traditional medical interventions.

questions.instructions: Questions 33-36. Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: 36. According to East, what is the percentage cost of natural remedies compared to western treatment?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! Natural remedies cost 10% (or less than ten percent) of western treatment. East states 'Natural remedies actually amount to less than ten percent of the cost'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is 10 (%). Listen when East discusses the financial benefits of natural remedies.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is 10 (%). East mentions the significant cost savings.

questions.instructions: Questions 37 and 38. Choose the correct letter A–C.
questions.question: 37. East cites the example of a baby to illustrate that natural remedies

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. While this may be true, it's not the main point of the baby example.
Incorrect. The point is more specific than just working on children.

mc_options.text: have benefits that are not just psychological
mc_options.feedback: ✓ Correct! The baby example demonstrates real physiological benefits, not just psychological effects.

questions.instructions: Questions 37 and 38. Choose the correct letter A–C.
questions.question: 38. East feels the best approach for the future is

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. East doesn't advocate completely rejecting western medicine.

mc_options.text: a combination of natural and western medicine
mc_options.feedback: ✓ Correct! East recommends 'an open-minded combination of the two forms'.
Incorrect. While research may be valuable, this isn't East's stated recommendation.

questions.instructions: Questions 39 and 40. Answer using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: 39. In which situation does East feel western medicine is the best option?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! EMERGENCY SURGERY is when western medicine is best. East states 'Take emergency surgery, for example. Obviously more natural remedies do not provide the speed required'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is EMERGENCY SURGERY. Listen when East acknowledges situations where western medicine is superior.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is EMERGENCY SURGERY. East gives this as a clear example of when western medicine is needed.

questions.instructions: Questions 39 and 40. Answer using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: 40. Who will be invited to argue the opposing view next week?

1.correct: ✓ Correct! DR MOORE will present the opposing view. The host says 'Next week we'll be inviting Dr Moore onto the programme to argue his case as a doctor'.
1.incorrect: ✗ Incorrect. The correct answer is DR MOORE. Listen to the closing remarks about next week's guest.
1.no_answer: No answer provided. The correct answer is DR MOORE. The host announces the next week's programme at the end.
